content: Does it make sense to a develop a NLP/ML model that will autocomplete the topic(if left blank) by analysing the content of message?
We have plenty of data to train this at least :)

Our UI is similar to email, where you make the topic name before you draft the message. And I think that's basically a sensible workflow. I view most of the problems in creating topics to be an onboarding issue. Users usually get the hang of it after a day or so, and while not all topics are perfect, they're generally good enough.

I think building ML systems is also harder than it looks. It's hard to write tests for regressions, for if the system is doing well or not, etc. Also, a few million messages is not be very much data for an NLP project, even if the messages come from a wide variety of realms :).
Maybe one day when we have dedicated teams working on NLP :)
Or outsource the task to kaggle? Quora did it once this year, with https://www.kaggle.com/c/quora-question-pairs 112MB of test data.

hmm. So identifying questions which have the same intent is a problem that Quora has to solve badly. I don't think auto completing topic names have similar urgency. But Kaggle is definitely a good idea if we want to implement some ML model in future as most Kaggle competitions breaks the previous accuracy records of the same problem by a huge margin.
Would anyone be up for a stream for ML/NLP discussion ? I have plenty ideas.
I just created #ML / NLP
